image.altText: A woman stands in front of a large group of alpacas

props.synopsis: Adelaide Hills resident Jodie Burr usually buys one tank of water a year. Since November, she's bought 10 and will have to wait eight weeks for her next delivery.

title.children: Water shortages leave Adelaide Hills farmers and householders 'at breaking point'

image.altText: Man in red hat stands in spiral staircase

props.synopsis: After decades of cultural division over the date chosen to celebrate Australia Day, hip hop artist Rulla Kelly-Mansell proposes a different date that marks one of the most unifying moments in the country's history.

title.children: Rapper's quest to 'find the date' prompts bold proposal for Australia Day

image.altText: Calcified tree roots in a cave.

props.synopsis: The Munro Karst system in South Australia's south-east could be 2 million years old and may contain rare fossils.

title.children: Push to have ancient cave system added to SA heritage list

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: SA Police has told the Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence, victims will wait longer for background checks on abusive partners without additional government funding.

title.children: DV victims to wait longer for background checks in SA, police call for more funding

image.altText: David Speirs is flanked by journalists and cameras outside the Adelaide Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: Negotiations between prosecutors and lawyers for former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs are underway, as his drugs charges are confirmed in court.

title.children: Drugs charges to proceed against former SA opposition leader

image.altText: A row of 12 guns resting diagonally on the front of a white car.

props.synopsis: A third man has faced court in New South Wales charged over an alleged robbery in South Australia in which collectable coins worth $1 million, cash and firearms were stolen.

title.children: Third man nabbed in alleged $1m collectable coin robbery

image.altText: A small mouse-like marsupial standing on sand, with a fat tail.

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Tanya Plibsersek is being taken to federal court by a conservation group over failure to list recovery plans for 11 threatened species.

title.children: 'Nature can't wait': Plibersek taken to court over threatened species

image.altText: Multiple red bugs sit on the front of a car headlight.

props.synopsis: Swarms of red bugs have appeared across South Australia in recent weeks as favourable weather conditions and abundant food sources allow the populations to flourish.

title.children: Swarms of mysterious red bugs appear across South Australia

image.altText: Port Augusta courts building

props.synopsis: A South Australian judge says the Department for Child Protection failed to remove a child who was being criminally neglected by her mother despite observing the toddler in "urine-soaked" clothing.

title.children: Mother sentenced after leaving toddler in dirty nappy for days

image.altText: An image of an SA Police officer's vest.

props.synopsis: Off-duty police officers have arrested a man who allegedly stabbed another man just one day after after a random, unrelated attack in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Man injured in alleged stabbing in second Adelaide CBD violent incident

image.altText: people on a jetty with a lighthouse at the end as waves crash over their heads

props.synopsis: Hazardous swells continue to develop all the way down into northern New South Wales with meteorologists predicting more coastal erosion in its wake.

title.children: 'Considerable erosion' leaves coast exposed to Cyclone Alfred flooding

image.altText: The side of a high-rise building with a pointed star logo with the words "The Star" below against a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Troubled casino operator Star Entertainment has barely enough cash to last until the weekend, increasing the likelihood of the company entering administration as early as Wednesday.

title.children: Star close to collapse with casino group set to run out of cash by Friday

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's offer to consider sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine if a request is made has sparked warnings about Australia's capacity to assist with a major new military deployment.

title.children: Doubts raised over Australia's capacity to help with peacekeeping in Ukraine

image.altText: An aerial photo shows a township with large green areas and a river running towards the coastline.

props.synopsis: In small towns across Australia, the lack of funding for infrastructure like sewerage, water supply and power is holding back projects that locals say could make a big difference in increasing the housing supply.

title.children: Land around small towns needs to become 'development-ready'

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a human skull.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it had "expertly assessed" several skeletal remains listed for sale by the auction house and the "sale of these anatomically prepared human remains" was not in breach of any state laws.

title.children: Auction house did not break law by selling human bones, police say

image.altText: A nuclear missile takes off.

props.synopsis: The number of nuclear weapons "available for use" continues to rise, with new research showing China, North Korea, India and Pakistan are increasing their stockpiles.

title.children: The number of deployable nuclear weapons has increased across the globe

image.altText: JD Vance speaks from behind a lectern with a US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: When JD Vance clashed with Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a meeting with him and Donald Trump in the Oval Office, it was the culmination of a years-long campaign the vice-president has waged against giving more money and assistance to Ukraine.

title.children: JD Vance's Oval Office spray followed a long campaign against Ukraine aid

image.altText: A woman standing outside of a caravan wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Recent research by the Grattan Institute has found the number of older Australians unable to afford rent is growing, and women are disproportionately affected.

title.children: Hidden homeless Australians finding solutions outside the system

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: The federal government has been accused of making a "sweetheart deal" to exempt YouTube from the teen social media ban, as YouTube's competitors kick off a co-ordinated public campaign against the move.

title.children: Government accused of making 'sweetheart deal' to exempt YouTube from social media ban

image.altText: Two grey fighter jets fly side-by-side against a blue and lightly cloudy sky

props.synopsis: The plane and its pilots lost contact during an engagement with insurgents in the country's south.

title.children: Fighter pilots and their jet lose contact during mission against insurgents

image.altText: A box of tea with the Rainforest Alliance logo.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation in Sri Lanka has found popular certification schemes are failing to live up to their ethical promises.

title.children: 'Not sustainable': The heavy price your 6c tea bag is exacting on others

image.altText: The AFL logo on the side of a building, partially obscured by a tree branch.

props.synopsis: Saturday used to be the home of footy but in 2025 fans better get used to paying to watch AFL on a Saturday, when most matches are traditionally played.

title.children: 'It's awful': Footy fans react to AFL's 2025 Saturday subscription TV model

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A mosque, white in colour, with a police car and cops out the front of it.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old from Western Australia is under arrest following NSW Police launching a major investigation into a social media threat against a mosque in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Teen arrested after investigation into threat against Sydney mosque

image.altText: A bag of iv fluids in a veterinary clinic.

props.synopsis: In a plan designed to end Australia's reliance on offshore IV fluids, the federal government will spend $20 million to expand the production facilities of the only local manufacturer of the essential medicine.

title.children: Local IV fluid production to increase dramatically amid global shortage

image.altText: A human in a bunny suit with blue gloves tests a sample on a rock in front of an endless sea of penguins on a rocky island.

props.synopsis: The deadly H5N1 strain of bird flu travelled 6,600 kilometres over the sea to Kerguelen Island, which is just 440km from Australia's Heard Island.

title.children: Deadly bird flu on remote island poses new threat to Australia

image.altText: Virat Kohli plays a shot as Josh Inglis looks on

props.synopsis: Virat Kohli shows why he is the master of the one day international chase with a Player of the Match performance as India books a ticket to Sunday's Champions Trophy final.

title.children: Kohli stars as India downs Australia to reach Champions Trophy final

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and solar panels.

props.synopsis: What Macquarie's departure from a global green alliance committed to cutting emissions tells us about the future of net zero finance.

title.children: Trump may have less to do with bank's net zero exit than meets the eye

image.altText: Hume stands at a lectern, an Australian flag beside her.

props.synopsis: Shadow Finance Minister Jane Hume pointed to Stanford Research when arguing that working from home hurt productivity. That same research found working from home part-time actually saw productivity gains.

title.children: Arguing against WFH, Hume cites research that supports hybrid work

image.altText: A man in a black suit shakes the hand of another man in a black suit and red tie in a grand room

props.synopsis: Min Aung Hlaing's military uses weapons from Russia in the ongoing civil war against opposition groups across Myanmar.

title.children: Myanmar military chief salutes Putin as 'king' during visit to Kremlin

image.altText: A hill covered in an orange blaze burning at night time, seen from the sea.

props.synopsis: As record-breaking snowfall is recorded in Japan's main island of Hokkaido, the country fights its worst wildfire in decades in the north-east.

title.children: Thousands of firefighters battle Japan's worst wildfire in decades

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer in hospital bed after surgery

props.synopsis: Following a scan, Professor Scolyer was told there had been concerning changes in his brain.

title.children: Richard Scolyer has 'complex surgery' to determine if cancer has returned

image.altText: A woman with long black hair in a black singlet top stand beside a colourful brick wall and stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: It's still not known how many students have been caught up in the business failure, whether they've lost their savings or if they can still come to Australia.

title.children: Questions swirl around collapse of major international student agency

image.altText: A wide shot of a parliament chamber with smoke and flares being thrown across the benches.

props.synopsis: The parliament's speaker says one politician has been left in a critical condition after suffering a stroke during the chaos, which comes amid mass anti-government protests in the country.

title.children: Opposition MPs let off smoke grenades in Serbian parliament
